name: Abwān
notes: A place of uncertain location but probably identical with the Abwanāt near the village of al-ʿAṭawī in the district of Fāraskūr. See Golb, "The Topography of the Jews of Medieval Egypt," p. 116.

name: al-Qaṣṣ
notes: Unidentified location thought to be in NW India

name: Barqa
notes:
The medieval city Barqa (not to be confused with the placename Barqa used for the eastern region, mostly interchangeable with Cyrenaica) was located in al-Marj, now called Old City Marj مدينة المرج القديمة
https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?params=32.4983_N_20.8928_E_globe:earth&language=en

name: Būra
notes:
"'A city on the seacoast near Damietta, from which come the būrī turbans and the būrī fish (=mullet).' Yāqūt, Muʿjam 1, p. 755; lying midway between Fāraskūr and Damietta."  See Golb, "The Topography of the Jews of Medieval Egypt," pp. 121–22.

Apparently on the site of present-day Kafr al-Baṭṭīkh.

name: Būṣīr
name_variants: Abū Ṣīr, אבו ציר, בו ציר, ابو صير, بوصير

name: Damietta
name_variants: Dimyāṭ, Dumyāṭ, אי כפתור, קפוטקיא, دمياط

name: Nafūsa
notes: The Nafusa mountains (Jebel Nafusa) or sometimes known simply as Nafusa, is a mountain range in modern-day western Libya. A not insignificant number of Geniza merchants hailed from Nafusa, but it is technically not a settlement location itself. Rather, the mountain is home to several towns and cities, most notably Zintan, Nalut, Jadu, Gharyan, Yefren, Kabaw, and others.

name: ואדי לינפש
notes: Unidentified location in Iberia, located "across the Tagus river. . . in the village of אלב̇יג̇ש." It is also possible to read the name as ואדי לעפש.
